Shenzhen Solitaire

Web port developed by Alexander McDowell alexander-mcdowell
Originally from SHENZHEN I/O developed by Zach Barth / Zachtronics

How to Play

To win Shenzhen Solitaire, you must:

  1. Stack all of the numbered cards in ascending order into three piles in the top right corner.
  2. Move the flower card to its pile in the top right.
  3. Consolidate all dragons to the free spaces in the top left.

Note that "ascending" / "descending" order must include all numbers 1-9.

Numbered cards must be stacked in descending order and alternating color.
A numbered card must be moved to a free space or a numbered card one more than it with different color.
Any stack of descending and alternating cards may be moved.

Dragon cards are represented by the symbols 中, 發, and ▯ and can only be moved to a free space.
If all dragon cards are visible and there is an available free space in the top left, the corresponding dragon button will light up.
Pressing the button will consolidate all dragons of that color and "lock" the free space, preventing any more cards from being placed.

The flower card, represented by the symbol ❀, may only move to the flower space in the top right.

An "auto-move" algorithm will automatically move cards that can move to the sorted pile without making the game impossible.
